overview.brief_description: Amalfi is a stunning coastal town perched dramatically on the cliffs of the Amalfi Coast, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Once a powerful maritime republic that rivaled Venice and Genoa, Amalfi now enchants visitors with its medieval architecture, dramatic coastal views, and authentic Italian charm. The town's whitewashed buildings cascade down the mountainside to meet the crystal-clear waters of the Tyrrhenian Sea.

sections.title: Maritime Republic History
sections.content: Amalfi was once one of Italy's most powerful maritime republics, controlling trade routes across the Mediterranean from the 9th to 11th centuries. The town's strategic location and naval prowess made it a major commercial hub, and remnants of this glorious past can still be seen in the impressive Duomo di Sant'Andrea and the historic Arsenale della Repubblica.

sections.title: Dramatic Coastal Setting
sections.content: Amalfi's most striking feature is its dramatic cliffside location, with colorful buildings cascading down the steep mountainside to meet the sea. The town offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Tyrrhenian Sea and the surrounding coastline, making it one of the most photographed destinations in Italy.

sections.title: Medieval Architecture
sections.content: The historic center of Amalfi is a maze of narrow, winding streets lined with whitewashed buildings, medieval towers, and historic churches. The magnificent Duomo di Sant'Andrea, with its distinctive Arab-Norman architecture and stunning bronze doors, stands as the town's architectural crown jewel.

sections.title: Lemon Culture
sections.content: Amalfi is famous for its production of limoncello and the distinctive Amalfi lemons (sfusato amalfitano). The town's terraced lemon groves, some dating back centuries, produce the large, sweet lemons that are used in local cuisine and the famous liqueur that has become a symbol of the region.

why_visit.intro: Amalfi offers visitors an authentic taste of Italian coastal life, combining rich history, stunning natural beauty, and traditional culture in one of the most picturesque settings in the Mediterranean.

highlights.title: Duomo di Sant'Andrea
highlights.content: Visit the magnificent Cathedral of Saint Andrew, a stunning example of Arab-Norman architecture. Climb the grand staircase to admire the intricate bronze doors, explore the beautiful Cloister of Paradise, and take in the breathtaking views from the cathedral's elevated position above the town.

highlights.title: Historic Center
highlights.content: Wander through Amalfi's charming historic center, where narrow alleys lined with whitewashed buildings lead to hidden piazzas, historic churches, and traditional shops. The medieval atmosphere and authentic Italian charm make every corner worth exploring.

highlights.title: Marina Grande
highlights.content: Stroll along the picturesque harbor area, where colorful fishing boats bob in the crystal-clear waters. This is the perfect spot to watch the sunset, enjoy a gelato, or simply soak in the authentic coastal atmosphere that makes Amalfi so special.

highlights.title: Paper Museum
highlights.content: Discover Amalfi's lesser-known but fascinating history at the Museo della Carta (Paper Museum). Housed in a 14th-century paper mill, this museum showcases how Amalfi became one of Europe's first centers of paper production, a tradition that continues today.

highlights.title: Coastal Walks
highlights.content: Explore the scenic walking paths that connect Amalfi to neighboring towns like Atrani and Ravello. The Sentiero degli Dei (Path of the Gods) offers spectacular views of the coastline and is perfect for nature lovers and photography enthusiasts.

highlights.title: Local Cuisine
highlights.content: Savor authentic Amalfi cuisine at traditional trattorias and restaurants. Sample local specialties like fresh seafood, handmade pasta, and the famous limoncello, all while enjoying the warm hospitality and stunning sea views that make dining in Amalfi unforgettable.

transport.public_transport: Amalfi is well-connected by SITA buses that run along the Amalfi Coast, connecting major towns. The town is also accessible by ferry from Salerno and other coastal destinations. Within Amalfi, most attractions are easily walkable, though the steep terrain requires comfortable shoes.
transport.passes: Consider purchasing a day pass for unlimited bus travel along the Amalfi Coast, which allows you to explore neighboring towns like Positano, Ravello, and Sorrento.

spring.description: Spring is an ideal time to visit Amalfi, with pleasant temperatures, blooming landscapes, and fewer crowds than summer. The lemon groves are in full bloom, and the weather is perfect for exploring the town and taking coastal walks.
considerations: Some seasonal businesses may still be opening

summer.description: Summer is peak season in Amalfi, with warm temperatures perfect for beach activities and outdoor dining. The town buzzes with energy, and all attractions and restaurants are fully operational, though it can be quite crowded.

fall.description: Autumn offers warm days and cooler evenings, making it perfect for outdoor activities without the summer crowds. The sea remains warm enough for swimming, and the surrounding countryside displays beautiful fall colors.

winter.description: Winter in Amalfi is mild compared to northern Italy, with temperatures rarely dropping below 10°C. While some tourist facilities may be limited, the town offers a peaceful atmosphere perfect for cultural exploration and enjoying the dramatic coastal scenery without crowds.

best_time_to_visit.summary: Amalfi is best visited from late spring (May) through early fall (October), when the weather is pleasant and all attractions are fully operational. May and June offer the perfect balance of good weather, blooming landscapes, and manageable crowds. July and August provide the warmest temperatures and liveliest atmosphere but also bring peak crowds and higher prices. September provides an excellent balance of good weather, fewer crowds, and the beautiful harvest season.

sites.name: Duomo di Sant'Andrea
sites.description: Amalfi's stunning 9th-century cathedral dedicated to Saint Andrew, featuring a magnificent Arab-Norman facade with intricate mosaics and a grand staircase. The cathedral houses the relics of Saint Andrew and showcases beautiful Byzantine and Romanesque architecture with stunning views of the town and sea.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round, but early morning offers the best light for photography and fewer crowds. Summer brings more visitors but also longer opening hours.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry to the main church. Small fee for the cloister and crypt. Modest dress required. Check mass times if you want to experience a service.

sites.name: Chiostro del Paradiso
sites.description: The beautiful 13th-century cloister adjacent to Amalfi Cathedral, featuring elegant Moorish-style arches, palm trees, and a peaceful garden. This architectural gem showcases the Arab influence on Amalfi's medieval architecture and provides a serene escape from the bustling town.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful in spring when flowers are blooming. Summer offers shade from the palm trees. Winter visits are peaceful with fewer tourists.
sites.booking_tips: Small entrance fee required. Combined tickets with cathedral available. Photography allowed. Perfect for quiet contemplation.

sites.name: Marina Grande
sites.description: Amalfi's main harbor and beach area, where colorful fishing boats and pleasure craft dock alongside the historic Arsenale della Repubblica. The marina offers beautiful sea views, waterfront restaurants, and access to boat tours along the stunning Amalfi Coast.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most vibrant during summer months with boat tours and beach activities. Evening offers beautiful sunset views and romantic dining atmosphere.
sites.booking_tips: Free to walk around. Boat tours should be booked in advance during peak season. Parking can be expensive and limited.

sites.name: Arsenale della Repubblica
sites.description: A 13th-century shipyard that once built the powerful Amalfi Republic's naval fleet. Now a museum showcasing Amalfi's maritime history, medieval shipbuilding techniques, and the city's former role as a major Mediterranean trading power.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for hot summer afternoons. The museum provides insight into Amalfi's golden age as a maritime republic.
sites.booking_tips: Small entrance fee. Guided tours available. Located near the marina for easy access. Check opening hours as they vary by season.

sites.name: Valle delle Ferriere
sites.description: A stunning natural reserve featuring waterfalls, ancient paper mills, and lush Mediterranean vegetation. This protected area showcases Amalfi's traditional paper-making industry and offers hiking trails through beautiful landscapes with views of the coast.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in spring and autumn for comfortable hiking temperatures. Summer can be hot and crowded. Winter offers peaceful solitude.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Wear sturdy hiking shoes and bring water. Some trails require moderate fitness. Guided tours available.

sites.name: Spiaggia Grande
sites.description: Amalfi's main beach featuring dark volcanic sand and crystal-clear Mediterranean waters. The beach offers stunning views of the town's dramatic cliffside architecture and is perfect for swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying the coastal atmosphere.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peak season is July-August when beaches are crowded. May-June and September offer pleasant weather with fewer crowds. Winter visits are peaceful but cold for swimming.
sites.booking_tips: Public beach areas are free. Beach equipment rentals available. Arrive early for best spots during summer. Limited facilities compared to larger resorts.

sites.name: Museo della Carta
sites.description: A fascinating museum dedicated to Amalfi's historic paper-making tradition, housed in a 13th-century paper mill. Visitors can learn about the ancient techniques used to create the famous 'bambagina' paper and see demonstrations of traditional paper production.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for hot summer afternoons or rainy days. The museum provides insight into one of Amalfi's most important historical industries.
sites.booking_tips: Small entrance fee. Guided tours and paper-making workshops available. Located in the historic center. Check for special events and demonstrations.

sites.name: Villa Rufolo
sites.description: A magnificent 13th-century villa with stunning gardens that inspired Wagner's 'Parsifal.' The villa features beautiful Moorish architecture, terraced gardens with panoramic sea views, and hosts the famous Ravello Festival concerts during summer months.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful in spring and early summer when gardens are in bloom. Summer offers evening concerts. Winter visits are peaceful with fewer crowds.
sites.booking_tips: Entrance fee required. Check concert schedule if interested in musical events. Photography allowed. Beautiful sunset views from the gardens.

sites.name: Sentiero degli Dei
sites.description: The famous 'Path of the Gods' hiking trail offering spectacular views of the Amalfi Coast, Capri, and the Mediterranean Sea. This challenging but rewarding trail connects Agerola to Nocelle, passing through beautiful landscapes and offering some of the best coastal views in Italy.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best in spring and autumn for comfortable temperatures. Summer can be very hot and crowded. Winter offers solitude but check weather conditions.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Requires good fitness level. Wear proper hiking shoes and bring water. Can be accessed from various points along the coast.

sites.name: Piazza del Duomo
sites.description: The heart of Amalfi, this beautiful square is dominated by the magnificent cathedral and surrounded by historic buildings, cafés, and shops. The square offers a perfect place to soak in the atmosphere, people-watch, and enjoy the architectural beauty of the town.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most atmospheric in the evening when locals and visitors gather. Summer brings street performers and increased activity. Winter offers peaceful charm.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for photography and people-watching. Many restaurants and cafés surround the square. Arrive early for dinner reservations.

sites.name: Grotta dello Smeraldo
sites.description: A stunning sea cave known for its emerald-green waters caused by underwater light filtering. Accessible by boat from Amalfi, the cave features beautiful stalactites and offers a unique perspective of the Amalfi Coast from the sea.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in calm weather conditions. Summer offers the most boat departures. Spring and autumn provide pleasant temperatures and fewer crowds.
sites.booking_tips: Boat tours must be booked in advance. Weather dependent - tours may be cancelled in rough seas. Bring camera for the beautiful emerald waters.

sites.name: Chiesa di Santa Maria a Mare
sites.description: A charming 12th-century church located near the marina, featuring beautiful frescoes and a peaceful atmosphere. This smaller church offers a more intimate religious experience compared to the grand cathedral and provides insight into Amalfi's spiritual heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peaceful atmosphere year-round. Early morning offers the most spiritual experience. Summer brings more visitors but maintains its charm.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry. Modest dress required. Photography may be restricted during services. Located near the marina for easy access.

sites.name: Via Lorenzo d'Amalfi
sites.description: Amalfi's main shopping street featuring local crafts, ceramics, limoncello, and traditional souvenirs. This pedestrian-friendly street offers authentic Amalfi products including handmade paper, local ceramics, and regional specialties.
sites.seasonal_notes: Active year-round with shops open most days. Summer brings more tourists and street vendors. Winter offers more authentic local shopping experience.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Many shops offer local specialties like limoncello and handmade paper. Bargaining not expected but some shops may offer discounts.

sites.name: Torre dello Ziro
sites.description: A medieval watchtower perched on a hill above Amalfi, offering spectacular panoramic views of the town, coast, and sea. This historic defensive structure provides insight into Amalfi's strategic importance and offers some of the best photo opportunities in the area.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful at sunset for photography. Spring and autumn offer comfortable temperatures for the uphill walk. Summer can be hot for the climb.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Requires moderate fitness for uphill walk. Wear comfortable shoes. Best reached by foot from the town center.

sites.name: Piazza dei Dogi
sites.description: A smaller, more intimate square featuring historic buildings and the remains of Amalfi's medieval palace. This quiet square offers a glimpse into the town's former political importance and provides a peaceful retreat from the main tourist areas.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peaceful year-round with fewer tourists. Early morning offers the most authentic atmosphere. Summer brings some visitors but maintains its charm.
sites.booking_tips: Free to visit. Perfect for quiet contemplation and photography. Located away from main tourist routes. Historical information available on plaques.

sites.name: Chiesa di San Salvatore de' Birecto
sites.description: A small but historically significant church dating from the 10th century, featuring beautiful Byzantine-style architecture and frescoes. This church represents one of Amalfi's oldest religious buildings and showcases the town's early Christian heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peaceful atmosphere year-round. Early morning offers the most spiritual experience. Summer brings some visitors but maintains its intimate feel.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry. Modest dress required. Photography may be restricted. Located in the historic center near other attractions.

sites.name: Fontana di Sant'Andrea
sites.description: A beautiful 18th-century fountain dedicated to Saint Andrew, featuring intricate stonework and traditional Amalfi design elements. Located near the cathedral, this fountain serves as a gathering point and represents the town's artistic and cultural heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Afternoon offers good lighting for photography. Summer brings more activity around the fountain area.
sites.booking_tips: Free to visit. Perfect for photography and people-watching. Located in the heart of the historic center. Can be crowded during peak tourist season.

sites.name: Punta Campanella
sites.description: A stunning natural promontory marking the western end of the Amalfi Coast, offering spectacular views of Capri, the Sorrentine Peninsula, and the Mediterranean Sea. This protected marine area provides excellent hiking opportunities and some of the most dramatic coastal scenery in Italy.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful at sunset for photography. Spring and autumn offer comfortable temperatures for hiking. Summer can be hot but offers the clearest views.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Requires good fitness for hiking. Wear appropriate footwear. Best reached by car or organized tour. Marine reserve restrictions apply.

Authentic fishing village famous for its anchovy production, beautiful harbor, and traditional Mediterranean atmosphere.
Colorful ceramics town marking the eastern end of the Amalfi Coast, with beautiful beaches and traditional workshops.

activities.name: Amalfi Coast Hiking - Sentiero degli Dei
activities.description: Experience the famous 'Path of the Gods' hiking trail with perfect spring weather. Enjoy spectacular coastal views, wildflowers in bloom, and comfortable temperatures for this challenging but rewarding hike.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers ideal hiking conditions with wildflowers blooming and pleasant temperatures. Fewer crowds than summer make it perfect for peaceful exploration.
activities.booking_tips: Start early to avoid afternoon heat. Bring water, snacks, and proper hiking shoes. Check trail conditions before departure.

activities.name: Spring Lemon Harvest Experience
activities.description: Visit local lemon groves during the spring harvest season. Learn about the famous Amalfi lemons, participate in harvesting, and taste fresh limoncello made from the season's first fruits.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is the beginning of lemon season with the first harvests. Perfect weather for outdoor activities in the groves.
activities.booking_tips: Book with local lemon producers in advance. Wear comfortable clothes and bring sun protection. Often includes limoncello tasting.

activities.name: Cathedral and Cloister Spring Visit
activities.description: Explore Amalfi's magnificent cathedral and beautiful cloister in perfect spring weather. Enjoy the stunning Arab-Norman architecture and peaceful garden atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers comfortable temperatures for exploring the historic center. Beautiful light for photography and fewer crowds than summer.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early morning for best light and fewer crowds. Modest dress required. Combined tickets available for cathedral and cloister.

activities.name: Spring Market at Mercato di Amalfi
activities.description: Experience the vibrant spring market with fresh seasonal produce, local specialties, and the authentic atmosphere of Amalfi's daily market.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings the most beautiful seasonal produce and fresh ingredients. Market is most lively on weekday mornings.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early for best selection. Bring a camera for the colorful displays. Try free samples from vendors.

activities.name: Coastal Photography at Sunset
activities.description: Capture stunning spring landscapes along the Amalfi Coast with perfect lighting conditions. Photograph the dramatic cliffs, colorful houses, and Mediterranean Sea.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring light provides excellent photography conditions. Wildflowers bloom along the coastal paths and viewpoints.
activities.booking_tips: Best light is 1-2 hours before sunset. Bring tripod for long exposures. Popular viewpoints can get crowded.

activities.name: Spring Beach Day at Spiaggia Grande
activities.description: Enjoy Amalfi's main beach before the summer crowds arrive. Perfect weather for sunbathing, swimming, and beachside dining with volcanic sand.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers pleasant temperatures and fewer crowds. Water may still be cool but beaches are peaceful and beautiful.
activities.booking_tips: Beach facilities open in spring with better prices than peak season. Bring layers for changing temperatures.

activities.name: Traditional Amalfi Cooking Workshop
activities.description: Learn to cook traditional Amalfi dishes using spring ingredients like fresh herbs, seasonal vegetables, and local olive oil.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring provides the best seasonal ingredients for authentic Amalfi cuisine. Perfect time to learn local culinary traditions.
activities.booking_tips: Book in advance with local cooking schools. Often includes market visits and full meal preparation.

activities.name: Boat Trip to Capri
activities.description: Take advantage of spring weather to visit the glamorous island of Capri with its stunning Blue Grotto, beautiful gardens, and Mediterranean charm.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers ideal conditions for island exploration. Fewer tourists and pleasant temperatures for sightseeing.
activities.booking_tips: Book ferry tickets in advance. Bring water and comfortable shoes for exploring the island.

activities.name: Amalfi Coast Boat Tour
activities.description: Experience the stunning Amalfi Coast from the water with boat tours to hidden coves, grottos, and coastal villages. Perfect for swimming and coastal photography.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides the most spectacular coastal views and perfect swimming conditions. Peak season for boat tours.
activities.booking_tips: Book boat tours well in advance during peak season. Consider private charters for more intimate experiences.

activities.name: Beach Club Experience at Spiaggia Grande
activities.description: Enjoy exclusive beach clubs with private beach access, water sports, gourmet dining, and stunning views of the dramatic coastline.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is peak season for beach clubs. Perfect weather for swimming, sunbathing, and luxury beach experiences.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve beach beds and dining well in advance. Dress codes may apply at upscale clubs.

activities.name: Sunset Sailing on the Mediterranean
activities.description: Charter a yacht or join a sailing excursion to experience the stunning Mediterranean sunset from the water, with views of the Amalfi Coast.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides the most spectacular sunsets and calm sea conditions. Perfect for romantic experiences.
activities.booking_tips: Book private charters or group excursions in advance. Sunset tours are most popular.

activities.name: Evening Stroll in Centro Storico
activities.description: Experience the magical evening atmosphere in Amalfi's historic center, with illuminated cathedral, charming streets, and Mediterranean backdrop.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are magical with warm temperatures and vibrant atmosphere. Perfect for people-watching and photography.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Best atmosphere during sunset and early evening. Many restaurants stay open late.

activities.name: Water Sports at Marina Grande
activities.description: Enjoy water sports including jet skiing, paddleboarding, and snorkeling at the main harbor with excellent facilities and clear waters.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers perfect water temperatures and calm conditions for water sports. Professional instructors available.
activities.booking_tips: Book water sports activities in advance during peak season. Equipment rental available on-site.

activities.name: Campania Wine Tasting
activities.description: Visit local vineyards in the Campania wine region to taste local wines and learn about Amalfi Coast winemaking traditions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers insights into winemaking. Indoor tastings provide relief from afternoon heat.
activities.booking_tips: Book vineyard tours in advance. Often includes transportation and food pairings. Designated driver required.

activities.name: Evening Aperitivo Culture
activities.description: Experience authentic Italian social life with evening aperitifs at waterfront cafés, watching the sunset over the Mediterranean.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are perfect for outdoor socializing. Experience the relaxed Mediterranean lifestyle.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed for most cafés. Best spots along the waterfront. Try local limoncello and Italian wines.

activities.name: Ravello Festival Concerts
activities.description: Experience the prestigious Ravello Festival with classical music concerts in stunning venues with panoramic views of the Amalfi Coast.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings the famous Ravello Festival with world-class performances in beautiful settings.
activities.booking_tips: Book concert tickets months in advance. Consider package deals with transportation from Amalfi.

activities.name: Autumn Hiking on Sentiero degli Dei
activities.description: Enjoy perfect hiking weather to explore the scenic coastal paths with stunning Mediterranean views and autumn colors.
activities.seasonal_notes: Ideal hiking temperatures without summer heat. Crystal clear autumn air provides spectacular coastal views.
activities.booking_tips: Start early to avoid afternoon heat. Bring camera and comfortable hiking shoes. Some trails require good fitness.

activities.name: Autumn Market at Mercato di Amalfi
activities.description: Experience the autumn harvest at Amalfi's main market with seasonal produce, local specialties, and authentic Italian atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings seasonal specialties like truffles, mushrooms, and autumn fruits. Market is less crowded than summer.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early for best selection. Try seasonal specialties and local autumn products.

activities.name: Truffle Season Culinary Experience
activities.description: Experience the start of truffle season in Campania, with special menus at local restaurants and truffle markets in nearby villages.
activities.seasonal_notes: Truffle season begins in autumn. Many restaurants feature special truffle menus during this period.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve at restaurants known for truffle dishes. Consider truffle hunting experiences in nearby areas.

activities.name: Wine Harvest in Campania
activities.description: Join local vineyards during harvest season to pick grapes and learn about traditional Campania winemaking.
activities.seasonal_notes: September to October is harvest season. Experience authentic agricultural traditions and seasonal rhythms.
activities.booking_tips: Contact local vineyards directly. Often includes meals and wine tasting. Advance booking essential.

activities.name: Storm Watching at Coastal Viewpoints
activities.description: Experience the dramatic autumn storms and wild seas from the safety of coastal viewpoints, watching powerful waves crash against the rocks.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings more dramatic weather and spectacular storm watching opportunities. Impressive wave action.
activities.booking_tips: Check weather conditions for safety. Best during windy days. Dress warmly and bring rain protection.

activities.name: Traditional Craft Workshops
activities.description: Learn traditional Amalfi crafts like ceramics, paper making, or limoncello production from local artisans.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is perfect for learning indoor crafts. Many artisans offer workshops as tourist season winds down.
activities.booking_tips: Book with local artisan associations. Often includes take-home pieces. Great for unique souvenirs.

activities.name: Mushroom Foraging in Local Forests
activities.description: Join guided foraging trips to discover edible mushrooms in local forests, learning about varieties and traditional uses.
activities.seasonal_notes: Peak mushroom season in local forests. Important part of traditional Italian cuisine and culture.
activities.booking_tips: Must join guided tours for safety. Often includes cooking session. Check weather for recent rain.

activities.name: Autumn Photography Tour
activities.description: Capture the stunning autumn colors and dramatic light along the Amalfi Coast with guided photography tours.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn provides perfect lighting conditions and dramatic skies for coastal photography.
activities.booking_tips: Book with local photography guides. Bring appropriate equipment for changing weather conditions.

activities.name: Christmas Market in Piazza del Duomo
activities.description: Experience the charming Christmas market featuring local Italian crafts, seasonal treats, and holiday decorations in the heart of Amalfi.
activities.seasonal_notes: Brings festive warmth to winter evenings. Features unique Italian holiday traditions and locally made gifts.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Best atmosphere in evening when lights are on. Try local holiday specialties.

activities.name: Indoor Museum and Cultural Sites
activities.description: Spend winter days exploring Amalfi's excellent museums including the Paper Museum and Arsenale della Repubblica during cooler weather.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect weather for indoor cultural exploration. Museums are less crowded and offer deeper exploration opportunities.
activities.booking_tips: Consider museum passes for multiple visits. Many offer guided tours. Combine with café stops for warmth.

activities.name: Traditional Italian Winter Meals
activities.description: Enjoy hearty winter meals featuring Italian specialties, truffles, and other traditional winter foods in cozy local restaurants.
activities.seasonal_notes: Peak season for traditional winter foods. Many restaurants feature special winter menus with seasonal ingredients.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve at traditional restaurants. Try pairing with local Campania wines and aged cheeses.

activities.name: Thermal Springs in Ischia
activities.description: Warm up in natural thermal springs on the island of Ischia, a perfect winter retreat offering relaxation and therapeutic benefits.
activities.seasonal_notes: Natural hot springs provide warmth during cooler months. Beautiful winter island scenery surrounding the springs.
activities.booking_tips: Check ferry schedules in winter. Bring towels and warm clothes for changing. Book thermal spa treatments in advance.

activities.name: Storm Photography and Coastal Views
activities.description: Capture dramatic winter storms and moody Mediterranean seascapes from coastal viewpoints and waterfront locations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter provides dramatic lighting and stormy seas perfect for photography. Clear post-storm days offer incredible visibility.
activities.booking_tips: Dress warmly and protect camera equipment. Best after storms when light is dramatic. Check wind conditions for safety.

activities.name: Cozy Wine Bar Evenings
activities.description: Warm up in traditional wine bars with local Campania vintages, charcuterie platters, and the company of locals during long winter evenings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect season for indoor socializing. Wine bars offer warmth, local atmosphere, and seasonal food pairings.
activities.booking_tips: No reservations usually needed. Learn basic Italian phrases for better interaction. Try different neighborhoods for variety.

activities.name: Winter Beach Walks
activities.description: Enjoy peaceful winter walks along the beaches with dramatic winter light, fewer crowds, and the therapeutic sound of winter waves.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter beaches offer peaceful solitude and dramatic natural beauty. Perfect for reflection and photography.
activities.booking_tips: Dress warmly and wear appropriate footwear. Best during low tide for beach exploration.

activities.name: Italian Olive Oil Tasting
activities.description: Visit local olive mills during the winter harvest season to taste fresh olive oil and learn about traditional production methods.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is olive harvest season in Italy. Experience the production of one of the region's most important products.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours in advance with local olive mills. Often includes tastings and product purchases.
